p: The phytochemical analysis of P. madagascariensis resulted in the isolation of five known compounds, namely, 6β,7α-dihydroxyroyleanone ( 1), 7α-acetoxy-6β-hydroxyroyleanone ( 2), horminone ( 3), coleon U quinone ( 4), and carnosolon ( 5). The NMR data of the isolated abietane diterpenoids were compared to those of previously isolated constituents from the plant and other species of the genus Plectranthus [ 13, 14, 15, 16].
